newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Forint eases vs dlr, BCE Ecu futures most traded.
newsitem.headline: Forint eases vs dlr, BCE Ecu futures most traded.

text.p: Hungary's forint closed Wednesday easier against the dollar after some speculative trading, dealers said.

"Speculative foreign currency buying by one of the major banks pushed the forint to a low of around 151.72 to the dollar and caused it to weaken some 25 pips compared to the central bank bid," said Gabor Liener of Unicbank. "But as excitement died down, the forint returned to the bid."
The forint closed at 151.52/57 to the U.S. unit compared with its opening of 151.42/47.
On the Budapest Commodity Exchange, Ecu futures accounted for two-thirds of a total 3.17 billion forints turnover, with the rest made up by dollar deals and a small batch of yen futures.
Mark, Ecu and yen futures ended mixed, the dollar finished mostly down, while sterling rose for three maturities.
